Description: Egyptian terracotta figure fragment of clothing drapery. Probably from a female figure(?). Traces of white coating and paint. Mould-made. Red-brown Nile silt fabric with abundant fine mica, quartz, organics and white inclusions.
Curator's comments: Uncertain of figure type, but detail, decoration and context suggest this is from a Ptolemaic figure.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (DD.393) (Phase 3)
